newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Feb 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Feb 21.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping died late on Wednesday after an 18-year rule in which China transformed itself from a backward Stalinist state to an economic powerhouse. He was 92. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- Gerry Penalosa, banking on an aggressive start and a superb finish, wrested the World Boxing Council super-flyweight title from Japanese champion Hiroshi Kawashima via a split decision last night in Tokyo, Japan. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- Businessmen told President Ramos Wednesday night that while they share his dismay over court intervention in economic affairs, they believe that a review of the Constitution at this time "might prove widely destructive." (TIMES/INQUIRER)
